1. Which of the following best describes an information system?
options: A. A system designed to collect, process, store, and distribute information
B. A system solely designed for physical document management
C. A system that doesn't require human interaction
D. A system that deals with physical documents only

questions.question: 2. What is the primary purpose of a management information system (MIS)?
options: A. To facilitate communication between employees
C. To analyze historical data for decision-making
D. To track financial transactions in real-time

questions.question: 3. In the context of information retrieval, what does the term "Boolean operators" refer to?
options: A. A method of organizing files in a hierarchical structure
B. Logical operators used to combine search terms
C. A type of database management system
D. A method for storing data in databases

options: A. To split large files into smaller segments
B. To combine multiple sorted files into a single sorted file
C. To convert unstructured data into structured data
D. To retrieve specific information from a database

options: B. The total number of nodes in the tree

D. The minimum number of children per node

options: A. Trees allow for faster searching

options: A. A dashboard showing last quarter’s revenue breakdown

1. Which of the following best captures the primary goal of an Information Retrieval system?
options: A. Maximizing the number of retrieved documents regardless of relevance
B. Providing users with the fastest possible system response time
C. Delivering the most relevant information quickly and efficiently
D. Ensuring all indexed documents are accessible to every user

questions.question: 2. In IR, an inverted index is primarily used to:
options: A. Store user queries for personalization purposes
B. Map terms to the documents in which they appear
C. Assign relevance scores to documents
D. Maintain security credentials for document access

questions.question: 3. Which query processing step involves transforming “run,” “runs,” and “running” into “run”?
4. In the Vector Space Model, document similarity is most often computed using:
5. BM25 is an example of a:
6. Which of these IR challenges is directly related to interpreting user intent from vague queries?
7. A recommendation system like Netflix uses IR techniques primarily to:
options: A. Crawl the web for new movies
C. Match user profiles to content embeddings

questions.question: 8. Which component of an IR system is responsible for ranking search results?
9. The Boolean model fails to rank results because it:
options: A. Applies weights to each term uniformly
B. Returns binary (true/false) matches without gradation
C. Requires deep neural networks for computation
D. Ignores the presence of stop-words entirely

questions.question: 10. Which of the following would be considered a multimodal retrieval task?
options: A. Searching a digital library of academic papers
B. Matching user-input text to image captions
C. Executing Boolean queries over an email archive
D. Ranking news articles by publication date

questions.question: 11. Explainable AI in IR aims to:
options: B. Provide transparent reasons for document rankings
C. Increase the speed of neural model inference
D. Automatically generate synonyms for query terms

questions.question: 12. Which IR application is most likely to require strict privacy controls?
options: B. Enterprise search of internal emails

questions.question: 13. Query expansion techniques are used to:
options: A. Reduce the runtime of ranking algorithms
B. Broaden user queries to include related terms
C. Compress the inverted index for storage

questions.question: 14. Scalability in IR mainly addresses:
options: A. The semantic interpretation of queries
B. Handling increasing volumes of data without performance loss
C. The fairness of ranking across demographic groups
D. The legal compliance of stored content

questions.question: 15. Which machine learning approach can directly learn from raw text to improve IR relevance?
16. In enterprise search, “data collection” typically includes:
options: A. Only publicly available web pages
B. Internal documents, emails, and intranet pages

questions.question: 17. A search engine’s user interface aids relevance by:
options: A. Automatically rewriting the index structure
B. Allowing users to filter and refine results

questions.question: 18. Which challenge arises when an IR system must serve millions of concurrent users?
19. Probabilistic models in IR estimate:
options: A. The exact file size of each document
B. The likelihood that a document satisfies a user’s information need
C. The number of unique terms in the corpus
D. The physical location of indexed servers

questions.question: 20. Contextual understanding in future IR systems refers to:
options: A. Parsing HTML tags in web pages
B. Using session history and user behavior to interpret queries
D. Limiting results to the top 10 documents

questions.question: 21. A digital library differs from a general search engine primarily in that it:
options: A. Indexes only academic and scholarly materials
B. Uses only the Boolean model for retrieval
C. Does not provide a user interface

questions.question: 22. Which technique would help improve relevance for voice-based search?
options: C. Query contextualization using previous utterances

questions.question: 23. In IR evaluation, Mean Average Precision (MAP) measures:
options: A. The average time to retrieve a document
B. The precision of relevant documents across multiple recall levels
C. The compression ratio of the index
D. The number of users who click on sponsored links

questions.question: 24. Which future trend focuses on integrating text, images, audio, and video in one search?
25. A downside of deep learning models in IR is often:
options: A. They require no training data
B. They always produce interpretable rankings
C. High computational cost and latency
D. They cannot handle large vocabularies

questions.question: 1. Which of the following statements about electric charge is not correct?
options: A. Charge is quantized in integral multiples of 1.60 × 10⁻¹⁹ C
B. Like charges repel, and unlike charges attract
C. Protons and electrons carry equal-magnitude charges but opposite signs
D. Charge can be created or destroyed during transfer between objects

questions.question: 2. An isolated neutral atom becomes a positive ion when it:
3. If you rub glass with silk, the glass typically acquires a net positive charge because:
options: A. Protons move from silk to glass
B. Electrons move from glass to silk
C. Electrons move from silk to glass
D. Neutrons move from silk to glass

questions.question: 4. How many electrons are needed to produce a charge of –3.2 × 10⁻¹⁸ C?
5. The SI unit of electric charge is defined as:
6. Which property distinguishes an insulator from a conductor?
options: A. Conductors have no free electrons
B. Insulators allow easy charge transfer
C. Conductors permit charge movement; insulators do not
D. Both have identical electron mobility

questions.question: 7. According to Coulomb’s law in vacuum, doubling the distance between two equal charges will:
8. Which expression correctly relates the Coulomb constant k to the permittivity of free space ε₀?
9. The principle of superposition states that the total electrostatic force on a charge is:
options: A. The product of individual forces
B. The vector sum of individual forces
C. The scalar sum of force magnitudes
D. Zero if more than two charges are present

questions.question: 10. Which scenario demonstrates the invariance of charge?
options: A. A fast-moving electron has more charge than a slow one
B. A proton’s charge changes when heated
C. A particle’s charge remains the same regardless of speed
D. Charge increases with kinetic energy

questions.question: 11. In Example 1.1, the number of electrons equivalent to 1 C was calculated as 6.25 × 10¹⁸. This follows directly from which relation?
12. Two point charges, +q and –q, are fixed 2 m apart. At the midpoint, the net force on a test charge will be:
13. Which of the following materials is a good electrical insulator?
14. If q₁ = 5 µC and q₂ = 5 µC, and they’re 1 m apart in air, the force between them (in N) is closest to:
15. Which fact was not explicitly stated in the introductory list of electrostatics experiments?
options: A. Two types of charge exist
C. Charge is invariant with speed
D. Electric fields exist in moving charge

questions.question: 16. An ion with charge +3e has how many excess protons compared to electrons?
17. When calculating the force vector F₁₂, the unit vector âᵣ points:
options: C. In the direction of the net force on both charges

questions.question: 18. Which of the following increases the electrostatic force between two charges?
options: B. Using a medium of higher permittivity
D. Increasing one of the charges

questions.question: 19. In the context of electrostatics, what does the term “diffuse cloud” refer to?
options: A. Proton distribution in the nucleus
B. Neutron shell around the nucleus
C. Electron distribution around the nucleus

questions.question: 20. Which law or principle ensures that the total charge in an isolated system remains unchanged?
1. Which capability most specifically separates an interactive dashboard from a standard report?
options: A. Fixed layout of charts and static tables
B. Real-time filtering and ad hoc drill-down on metrics
C. Inclusion of historical archives for compliance
D. Export-only functionality for offline review

questions.question: 2. In choosing a store location, geospatial analytics provides advantage mainly by:
options: A. Optimizing font and color for signage
B. Revealing spatial trends like customer density and travel corridors
C. Ensuring server redundancy across regions
D. Automating payroll for nearby staff

questions.question: 3. Which task would NLP be LEAST suited to handle without other sensors or systems?
options: B. Translating sentiment from reviews into scores
C. Detecting a sudden mechanical vibration on conveyor belts
D. Enabling keyword search across documents

questions.question: 4. Predictive maintenance achieves value primarily by:
options: A. Eliminating all scheduled maintenance entirely
B. Forecasting failures to plan interventions before breakdowns
C. Increasing inventory turnover for finished goods
D. Minimizing data collection to save storage costs

questions.question: 5. The primary technical benefit of edge computing in MIS is:
options: A. Moving all processing to centralized cloud datacenters
B. Reducing latency by processing near data sources
C. Automatically replacing blockchain for audit trails
D. Serving as a backup for paper records

questions.question: 6. A suitable MIS use for blockchain is:
options: A. Fast in-memory analytics on terabytes of telemetry
B. Immutable traceability of transactions across suppliers
C. Replacing encryption for confidential files
D. Hosting large media files cheaply

questions.question: 7. Behavioral analytics in cybersecurity is best described as:
options: A. A static list of allowed IP addresses
B. Modeling user patterns to flag anomalous actions
C. Replacing identity verification with anonymous access
D. Limiting all remote access by default

questions.question: 8. The core tenet of Zero Trust is:
options: A. Trust internal network traffic implicitly
B. Always verify identity and permissions before granting access
C. Use VPN as the sole security control
D. Grant broad rights to simplify workflows

questions.question: 9. Which design focus most directly reduces user resistance during MIS rollout?
options: A. User-centric design that prioritizes usability and feedback
B. Only adding advanced technical features for admins
C. Hiding system changes until after deployment
D. Switching vendors frequently during development

questions.question: 10. An early engagement strategy for adoption should include:
options: A. Releasing the system without consulting users
B. Conducting workshops, pilots and collecting stakeholder input
C. Outsourcing all communication to a PR firm only at launch
D. Forcing a single standardized workflow regardless of teams

questions.question: 11. Which KPI is most relevant to measure user-facing MIS quality?
options: B. Average sentence length in internal emails
C. Number of coffee machines in the office
D. Color palette consistency across reports

questions.question: 12. Benchmarking helps an organization by:
options: A. Creating internal jargon to limit comparisons
B. Comparing performance against peers to set improvement targets
C. Eliminating the need for user feedback entirely
D. Stopping performance measurement once benchmarks are set

questions.question: 13. The main advantage of a modular architecture is:
options: A. Forcing major rewrites whenever a feature changes
B. Allowing incremental upgrades and replacing components independently
C. Increasing tight coupling for faster development
D. Preventing reuse of any component across projects

questions.question: 14. Which statement about cloud integration is most accurate?
options: A. It guarantees lower cost for every workload
B. It facilitates scalability, remote access and disaster recovery options
C. It removes the need for governance and compliance
D. It makes on-premise backups obsolete in all cases

questions.question: 15. A data steward is primarily responsible for:
options: A. Physical maintenance of storage racks
B. Overseeing data quality, definitions and compliance for a domain
C. Designing logos for data products
D. Managing printing quotas across departments

questions.question: 16. Which activity would NOT normally be part of data cleansing?
options: D. Randomly purging recent transaction logs without checks

questions.question: 17. The defining feature of a digital twin is that it:
options: A. Is a static snapshot of a device taken once annually
B. Is a dynamic virtual replica simulating real-time behavior
C. Only stores maintenance manuals without sensor inputs
D. Replaces the physical asset with a software-only product

questions.question: 18. Which scenario best matches an application of digital twins?
options: A. Cosmetic redesign of a website homepage
B. Running scenario tests to optimize machine throughput and uptime
C. Archiving email threads for audit only
D. Replacing database indexes to speed queries

questions.question: 19. Combining RPA and AI enables automation that can:
options: A. Only click GUI buttons with deterministic steps
B. Interpret documents and make judgment calls on unstructured inputs
C. Remove the need for human oversight in every process
D. Work solely at physical device driver level

questions.question: 20. The most valuable outcome of an AI-driven CRM is:
options: A. Consolidating raw server logs into a single table
B. Delivering insights on customer behavior enabling targeted actions
C. Deleting old customer records to reduce storage
D. Forcing all customers to use a single communication channel

questions.question: 21. Omnichannel integration in CRM primarily ensures:
options: A. Independent, unconnected customer records per channel
B. Unified customer interactions to create seamless experiences
C. That only social media is used for customer contact
D. That CRM data is visible to all public internet users

questions.question: 22. The core advantage of connecting IoT devices to MIS is:
options: A. Increasing paperwork through manual logs
B. Getting continuous operational measurements for timely decisions
C. Replacing managerial roles entirely with sensors
D. Preventing any automated actions based on sensor data

questions.question: 23. Using IoT for predictive analytics typically aims to:
options: A. Aggregate only weekly totals for reporting
B. Forecast equipment issues and operational trends for proactive action
C. Reduce the number of sensors to one per site for simplicity
D. Make historical dashboards the sole output of the system

questions.question: 24. Data democratization is best described as:
options: A. Hiding data access behind a strict IT-only policy
B. Providing broader access to data and enabling employees to use analytics tools
C. Publishing sensitive customer data to all employees by default
D. Training only the executive team on analytics tools

questions.question: 25. A real risk introduced by self-service BI is:
options: A. Faster insight delivery to empowered users
B. Metric divergence and inconsistent calculations if governance is weak
C. Total elimination of IT responsibilities overnight
D. Permanent improvement of data accuracy without oversight

questions.question: 26. For data security and privacy, which practice would be counterproductive?
options: A. Implementing encryption and access controls
B. Regular security audits and compliance checks
C. Publishing raw customer data publicly for transparency
D. Keeping policies updated with regulatory changes

questions.question: 27. To reduce integration complexity, organizations should:
options: A. Write bespoke point-to-point adapters for every new tool forever
B. Use middleware, APIs and thorough testing as integration strategy
C. Mothball all legacy systems without migration planning
D. Integrate only by manual CSV exports indefinitely

questions.question: 28. Sound cost management for MIS implementations usually includes:
options: A. Buying the most expensive turnkey solution without ROI analysis
B. Running cost–benefit analyses and considering cloud or open-source options
C. Cutting training and change management to save money
D. Ignoring operational costs after the purchase

questions.question: 29. Successfully adapting to tech change depends mostly on:
options: A. Freezing staff skill development to maintain stability
B. Continuous learning programs and monitoring new technologies
C. Outsourcing all innovation decisions with no internal input
D. Avoiding experimentation altogether to prevent disruption

questions.question: 30. The most reliable ways to ensure data accuracy include:
options: A. Turning off validation to speed ingestion
B. Implementing validation rules, audits and data quality tools
C. Letting users freely overwrite authoritative records without logs
D. Relying on ad hoc manual checks once every few years

questions.question: 31. Amazon’s MIS strengths in e-commerce are mainly:
options: A. Producing entertaining product descriptions only
B. Integrating inventory control, personalization and logistics analytics
C. Using MIS only for payroll processing
D. Removing choice to simplify the catalog to one item

questions.question: 32. The Mayo Clinic’s MIS example mainly shows value by:
options: A. Offering music playlists for patient rooms
B. Integrating EHRs, patient workflows and clinical decision support
C. Outsourcing medical records without interoperability
D. Using MIS only for hospital gift shop sales

questions.question: 33. JPMorgan Chase’s MIS example emphasizes:
options: A. Casual record-keeping for cafeteria menus
B. Real-time monitoring, risk controls and fraud detection at scale
C. Using MIS solely for HR onboarding forms
D. Excluding compliance functions from system design

questions.question: 34. GE’s manufacturing MIS highlights integration of:
options: A. Office email systems with social profiles
B. IoT telemetry, production control, supply chain and predictive upkeep
C. Single-use spreadsheets for all decisions

questions.question: 35. Which challenge–solution pairing accurately reflects the lecture note?
options: A. Integration complexity — publish undocumented APIs to users
B. Ensuring data accuracy — implement validation, audits and quality tools
C. Cost management — ignore ROI and buy top-tier licenses only
D. Adapting to change — prohibit staff training to reduce churn

questions.question: 1. Which of the following is NOT typically considered a component of Information Systems (IS)?
2. Management Information Systems (MIS) primarily focus on:
options: B. Providing managers with tools for decision-making
C. Managing hardware and networking equipment

questions.question: 3. An example of an Information System that integrates different business functions like finance and HR is:
4. Which of the following best describes the scope difference between IS and MIS?
options: A. IS is focused only on managerial decision-making
B. MIS has a broader scope including all types of data processing
C. IS covers a broad range of systems, while MIS focuses on managerial support
D. MIS is unrelated to organizational data handling

questions.question: 5. Which sector example involves an MIS generating monthly sales reports to aid regional managers?
6. A challenge in integrating IS and MIS systems often involves:
options: B. Data silos with incompatible data structures

questions.question: 7. What is a common benefit of integrating various Information Systems with MIS?
options: B. Enhanced decision-making through unified data views
C. More complex manual data entry

questions.question: 8. In the historical development of IS and MIS, early systems mainly automated:
options: B. Routine tasks like payroll and inventory

questions.question: 9. Which modern technology trend has enhanced both IS and MIS with scalability and remote access?
10. Which MIS example provides high-level summaries and dashboards specifically for senior executives?
11. Process integration in IS and MIS refers to:
options: A. Using middleware to connect hardware devices
B. Combining business processes across systems for synchronized operations
C. Developing new software applications from scratch
D. Creating isolated systems to handle data separately

questions.question: 12. What type of data handling is emphasized more in MIS compared to IS?
options: B. Presentation of processed data in reports and dashboards

questions.question: 13. Which of the following is NOT an example of an Information System?
14. A banking institution's system that generates financial reports and conducts risk analysis is an example of:
15. The narrow scope of MIS primarily supports:
options: B. Managerial functions such as planning and control

questions.question: 16. Which of the following technologies is contributing to enhanced automation and pattern recognition in MIS?
options: B. Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

questions.question: 17. In a manufacturing environment, which system manages production processes and machine performance?
18. Which integration technique involves unifying data from ERP, CRM, and TPS for analysis within MIS?
19. Which of the following is NOT a key purpose of Information Systems (IS)?
options: B. Supporting a broad range of organizational functions
C. Focusing solely on managerial decision-making

questions.question: 20. A hospital's system that tracks clinical performance metrics to support strategic decisions is best classified as:
21. What major challenge increases complexity in integrating IS and MIS?
options: B. Technical difficulty requiring resources and expertise

questions.question: 22. Which system type is primarily designed for use by operational staff rather than managers?
23. The main purpose of Decision Support Systems (DSS) is to:
options: B. Provide analytical tools for complex decision-making

questions.question: 24. Which of these best describes the role of people in Information Systems?
options: B. Users and IT professionals interacting with the system

questions.question: 25. The use of dashboards in MIS primarily aims to:
options: B. Visualize and summarize information for managers

questions.question: 26. Hyperautomation in the context of IS and MIS refers to:
options: A. Automating simple manual tasks only
B. Combining multiple advanced technologies to automate complex processes
C. Reducing automation to only critical functions
D. Manual monitoring of automated systems

questions.question: 27. Which of the following best captures the distinction between IS and MIS users?
options: A. IS users are only managers
B. MIS users include operational staff and customers
C. IS users span all organizational roles, MIS users are mainly managers
D. MIS users include only IT professionals

questions.question: 28. An example of process integration would be:
options: A. Using separate software for order processing and inventory without linking
B. Connecting order processing systems with inventory and MIS to synchronize data
C. Maintaining isolated databases for sales and inventory
D. Disabling system communications for security

questions.question: 29. Which statement accurately reflects the evolution of MIS in the 1980s and 1990s?
options: A. MIS declined in importance during this period
B. MIS began to emphasize decision support and strategic planning tools
C. MIS focused mainly on hardware advancements
D. MIS replaced all operational systems

questions.question: 30. What role does Big Data Analytics play in modern MIS?
options: A. Limits the amount of data processed
B. Analyzes vast datasets to provide deeper insights and predictions
C. Simplifies data by removing all complexity
